intro: Saccolabium tierneyanum, commonly known as the Tierney's sicklepod, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Saccolabium tierneyanum is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
